title: Beginner Unit Testing in iOS App Development
headline: Study protocol-oriented programming, unit testing, user interface testing and more in iOS app development for free.
description: This free online iOS app development course will build on your knowledge of iOS and Swift to delve into more advanced iOS development topics such as protocol-oriented programming (POP), reactive programming, unit and UI testing, and the Vision Framework for iOS. iOS development is a fast-growing industry and, with this course, you will gain the skills to create robust applications integral to becoming a successful developer.

courseDescription:
iOS app development is a booming industry. Having the ability to create industry-standard, robust applications is a huge benefit to employers. This course begins by introducing you to the concept of unit testing in programming and highlights its importance in iOS development.

The course then outlines how unit testing is the breaking down of code into separate components and testing each individual component to ensure it performs as designed. You will also learn about working with test-driven development, code refactoring, what defines a good test, the A TRIP acronym and Xcode's unit testing platform - XCTest. 

If you are interested in a career in app development, or you are a professional looking to learn new skills, then this is the course for you. The topics are explained clearly and concisely and you will learn about their real-life applications. Start this free online course today and gain the skills necessary to become an iOS developer!

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Introduction to Unit Testing and Data Models
modules.description: This module introduces the concept of Unit Testing in programming and highlights the importance of it in iOS development. It outlines how unit testing is the breaking down of code into separate components and testing each individual component to ensure each performs as designed. It also describes working with test-driven development, code refactoring, what defines a good test, the A TRIP acronym and Xcode's unit testing platform - XCTest.
topics: Introduction to Unit Testing and Data Models - Learning Outcomes
What Makes a Good Unit Test
Introduction to Unit Testing and Data Models - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module continues to develop your knowledge of unit testing and how to implement unit testing for different functions and features. It outlines how unit testing should be used in various situations. It describes how to test asynchronous code, test endpoints, working with MVVM and work with mock data. The module also outlines what performance testing is and how to use benchmarking to highlight how a piece of software is performing.
topics: Advanced Unit Testing in iOS 12 - Learning Outcomes
Advanced Unit Testing in iOS 12 - Lesson Summary
